node.display_name: Waltz of the Wizard: Extended Edition
node.display_long_description:
Experience creative and destructive magical powers in a fantasy world full of detail, where everything is interactive and intuitive like reality — HAND TRACKING & QUEST 2 FEATURES!

Combine arcane ingredients into a boiling cauldron and cast creative and destructive spells in a fully interactive world, solve riddles, battle ancient guardians and discover the many details of a mysterious world designed to feel like a believable reality. 

If you have ever wanted to make things disappear with a snap of your finger, throw fireballs, or telekinesis, then this experience is for you. A major upcoming ‘Natural Magic’ expansion will add new areas and advanced magic.

“VR already has some exceptionally well-received games, like Waltz of the Wizard” -Rolling Stone Magazine

“Waltz of the Wizard has some of the most impressive uses of VR I've seen yet” -Polygon

“Spent tonight playing catch with an animated wall statue. VR is giving me the childhood I never had!” -Norman Chan, Tested

nodes.title: Lightning Update
nodes.body_text:
We’ve been thrilled by the phenomenal response to our hand-tracking update on Oculus Quest last month. Today we are happy to reveal EVEN MORE features and improvements for Quest in our Lightning update, available right now! This time around we are introducing Slingshot fingers that lets you fire projectiles, lightning hands with the power to electrocute everything, new accessibility mode for those with missing fingers, a new easter egg (good luck!) and multiple improvements to existing features, including gesture recognition.

We believe VR is a medium that has potential to make computing more accessible than any medium to date. It has always been important to us to make virtual reality accessible to as many people as possible. For example, from the very start Waltz was—and still is—one of the few VR games designed to work using only one hand.

When we released the initial hand-tracking update in May we received a request from a user who had issues with Quest’s hand-tracking due to missing fingers, leading to that user experiencing uncomfortable sensations. We’re happy to release this new feature to let users improve their experience by making virtual representations of missing fingers move in sync with other fingers, instead of randomly moving due to non-existant tracking data.

We greatly value feedback and discussions on all Waltz and VR related things and anyone is always welcome to join our Discord! (https://discord.gg/cxHB5zF)

We have big plans for Waltz of the Wizard this year that we are very excited about. While we can’t share details just yet, let’s just say we are opening new doors for the future of Waltz of the Wizard — with our strong focus on VR design innovation, as always.

Full blog post available here: https://medium.com/aldin-dynamics/lightning-update-waltz-of-the-wizard-on-oculus-quest-45b0ad5a7ab

node.appName: Waltz of the Wizard: Extended Edition

node.reviewDescription:
I'm a 71-year-old and I have never experienced VR before.
Thanks to being at home so much because of covid-19 I recently purchased an Oculus quest.
Unbelievable absolutely unbelievable it was so much fun I don't know how to explain it.
When I found the application with hand tracking it was even more amazing my grandchildren come over just to try that because they love the spells absolutely wonderful don't change well if you want you can get better and give us more rooms that'll be fine but right now this is a totally new experience and I absolutely love it.

website_page_meta.description: Feel what it’s like to wield magical powers with your own bare hands! One of the highest rated PC VR experiences now on Quest in this remaster of the beloved original. Combine arcane ingredients into a boiling cauldron with the help of an ancient talking skull, unleashing diverse wizardry upon a fully interactive and mysterious believable reality.
website_page_meta.title: Waltz of the Wizard: Extended Edition · Oculus Quest
